title: Semantik Architect Frame Schema: Law / Treaty / Policy
description:
JSON schema for `entity.legal_instrument` frames used by the Semantik Architect CLI and AW bridge.

The schema describes the normalized payload that will be converted into an internal `LawTreatyPolicyFrame`.

frame_type.description: Canonical frame type identifier. Must be `entity.legal_instrument`.

instrument_kind.description: High-level kind of legal instrument. After normalization typically one of `treaty`, `law`, `constitution`, `policy`, `agreement`, `convention`, `charter`, `statute`, but arbitrary non-empty strings are allowed.

jurisdiction.description: Jurisdiction in which the instrument applies (e.g. a country, state, or supranational body).

signing_event.description: Event representing the signing or adoption of the instrument.

coming_into_force_event.description: Event representing the entry into force of the instrument.

repeal_event.description: Event representing the repeal, expiry, or supersession of the instrument, if applicable.

status.description: Short label for the current legal status (e.g. 'in force', 'repealed', 'partially in force', 'superseded').

parties.description: For treaties / agreements: parties or signatories (states, organizations). For purely domestic laws this is usually empty.

subjects.description: High-level subject domains or policy areas as simple lemmas (e.g. 'trade', 'environment', 'healthcare').

articles_or_sections.description: Identifiers of key articles / sections (e.g. 'Article 1', 'Section 2'); primarily for reference and usually not surfaced in a short lead sentence.

legal_citations.description: Legal citation strings such as official publication references, docket numbers, or standard citation formats (e.g. 'Pub. L. 111â€“148').

attributes.description:
Arbitrary attribute map for additional structured properties.

Recommended keys include:
- `scope` (string): e.g. 'international', 'national', 'local'.
- `binding` (boolean): whether the instrument is legally binding.
- `subject_matter` (array[string]): more fine-grained subject tags.
- `language_versions` (array[string]): languages in which the text is officially available.

Unknown keys are preserved and may or may not be surfaced by NLG.

extra.description: Opaque source-specific metadata not interpreted by the core semantics/NLG layer. Use this to carry original IDs, raw fields, or debugging information.

EntityRef.description: Lightweight reference to an entity in the Semantik Architect knowledge graph or an external source. At least one identifier (`id`, `qid`, or `name`) SHOULD be provided.

id.description: Opaque internal identifier for the entity (database or graph ID).

name.description: Surface name of the entity in a reference language.

lang.description: Optional BCP-47-like language tag for `name`, e.g. 'en', 'fr'.

extra.description: Free-form payload attached to the entity reference.

TimeSpan.description: Approximate or exact time span for an event. All fields are optional; callers may encode a single point (`point`) or an interval (`start`/`end`).

start.description: Start of the interval in ISO-8601 form, e.g. '1995-01-01' or '1995-01-01T00:00:00Z'.

end.description: End of the interval in ISO-8601 form.

point.description: Instantaneous timestamp in ISO-8601 form when appropriate.

EventRef.description: Lightweight representation or reference for an event.

id.description: Opaque internal identifier for the event (database or graph ID).

name.description: Short human-readable label for the event.

extra.description: Free-form payload attached to the event reference.
